DESCRIPTION: Performance counters for Linux are a new kernel-based subsystem that provide a framework for all things performance analysis. It covers hardware level (CPU/PMU, Performance Monitoring Unit) features and software features (software counters, tracepoints) as well.
inherit:
linux-kernel-base kernel-arch manpages
python3native
python3-dir
perlnative cpan-base
kernelsrc
EXTRA_OEMAKE:
'    V=1     -C ${S}/tools/perf     O=${B}     CROSS_COMPILE=${TARGET_PREFIX}     ARCH=${ARCH}     CC="${CC}"     CCLD="${CC}"     LDSHARED="${CC} -shared"     AR="${AR}"     LD="${LD}"     EXTRA_CFLAGS="-ldw"     EXTRA_LDFLAGS="${PERF_EXTRA_LDFLAGS}"     perfexecdir=${libexecdir}     NO_GTK2=1     ${PACKAGECONFIG_CONFARGS}     TMPDIR="${B}"     LIBUNWIND_DIR=${STAGING_EXECPREFIXDIR} '
    'DESTDIR=${D}'     'prefix=${prefix}'     'bindir=${bindir}'     'sharedir=${datadir}'     'sysconfdir=${sysconfdir}'     'perfexecdir=${libexecdir}/perf-core'     'ETC_PERFCONFIG=!!!inlineblock!!!'     'sharedir=!!!inlineblock!!!'     'mandir=!!!inlineblock!!!'     'infodir=!!!inlineblock!!!'     PYTHON=python3 PYTHON_CONFIG=python3-config 
 JOBS=1
PERF_SRC: Makefile              tools/arch              tools/build              tools/include              tools/lib              tools/Makefile              tools/perf              tools/scripts              scripts/              arch/${ARCH}/Makefile 
